    • Method Detail

      • getGLVersion

        public static CoreVersion.GLVersion getGLVersion(int versionMajor,
                                                 int versionMinor)

      • getGLVersionFromString

        public static CoreVersion.GLVersion getGLVersionFromString(String vstr)
        Returns a GLVersion enum instance corresponding to the OpenGL version specified by the given string. It is valid to pass the output from glGetString(GL_VERSION) into this method, as it will look for the GL version major/minor only at the beginning of the string and ingore everything that follows (i.e. vendor/driver info, release number, etc).
        Parameters:
        vstr - the GL version string to parse
        Returns:
        corresponding GLVersion, if given input is a valid OpenGL version.

      • checkCurrentGLVersion

        public static boolean checkCurrentGLVersion(CoreGL gl,
                                            CoreVersion.GLVersion verCheck)
        Convenience method - equivalent to: gl.getUtil().getGLVersion().checkAgainst(verCheck);
        Parameters:
        gl - used to get the version of the currently active GL context
        verCheck - the version to check against
        Returns:
        true if the current GL version is greater than or equal to verCheck

      • getGLSLVersion

        public static CoreVersion.GLSLVersion getGLSLVersion(int versionNumber)

      • getGLSLVersionFromString

        public static CoreVersion.GLSLVersion getGLSLVersionFromString(String vstr)
        Returns a GLVersion enum instance corresponding to the GLSL version represented by the given string. There are two valid formats for the input string:
        1) glGetString(GL_SHADING_LANGUAGE_VERSION) should return a version String in the version format [MAJOR].[MINOR] or [MAJOR].[MINOR].[RELEASE] followed by vendor specific driver information. It is valid to pass in this value to this method; the release number (if any) as well as the trailing vendor information will be discarded and the major/minor version IDs parsed.
        2) It is also valid to simply pass in a string value of the version number; i.e. "150" for GLSL version 150.
        Parameters:
        vstr - the GLSL version string (in a correct format) to parse.
        Returns:
        the GLSLVersion corresponding to the given version input string.

      • checkCurrentGLSLVersion

        public static boolean checkCurrentGLSLVersion(CoreGL gl,
                                              CoreVersion.GLSLVersion verCheck)
        Convenience method - equivalent to: gl.getUtil().getGLSLVersion().checkAgainst(verCheck);
        Parameters:
        gl - used to get the version of GLSL supported by the currently active GL context
        verCheck - the version to check against
        Returns:
        true if the current GLSL version is greater than or equal to verCheck
